data.title: Bhumjaithai seeks to preserve local positions
data.description: The Bhumjaithai Party has submitted two bills aimed at preserving the positions of village and sub-district headmen in municipalities, saying they are needed to facilitate effective work with residents.

data.title: New border checkpoint opens in Sa Kaeo
data.description: Thailand and Cambodia have opened the Thai-Cambodian Friendship Bridge permanent  border checkpoint  in Sa Kaeo province, and also extended the hours at the Chong Sa-ngam checkpoint in Si Sa Ket province to boost trade and tourism.

data.title: Thai territory bordering Cambodia is safe, says government
data.description: The government denied taking action regarding Koh Kut in Trat province while assuring the public that Thailand would not lose it to Cambodia.

data.title: 483,000 to be granted citizenship
data.description: The cabinet has approved a policy to grant Thai citizenship to over 483,000 migrants and members of ethnic minorities who have lived in Thailand long-term or were born in the kingdom.

data.title: Bangkok offers incentives for rubbish sorters
Man hit, killed by train in southern Thailand
data.description: SURAT THANI - A 45-year-old man was found dead after being struck by the Trang-Bangkok express train in this southern province on Wednesday, a day before his housewarming ceremony.

data.title: Baby steps on road to joining Organisation for Economic Co-operation
data.description: Thailand hopes to join the  Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development  (OECD) as it sees rising opportunities from a  strategic convergence  between the two, according to Foreign Minister Maris Sangiampongsa.

data.title: Thai Airways cancels Taipei flights as Taiwan prepares for Typhoon Kong-rey
data.description: Thai Airways International suspended three flights to and from Taipei on Thursday and one on Friday due to the approach of Typhoon Kong-rey.

data.title: Vietnam jails blogger snatched from Thailand
data.description: A Vietnamese  blogger  who was reportedly  abducted  from Thailand last year has been sentenced to 12 years in prison for disseminating anti-party and anti-state content, according to local media reports.
